nullable-integration.title: GitHub app
nullable-integration.description: GitHub apps are a new way to extend GitHub. They can be installed directly on organizations and user accounts and granted access to specific repositories. They come with granular permissions and built-in webhooks. GitHub apps are first class actors within GitHub.

id.description: Unique identifier of the GitHub app

slug.description: The slug name of the GitHub app

name.description: The name of the GitHub app

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the GitHub app

events.description: The list of events for the GitHub app

installations_count.description: The number of installations associated with the GitHub app

description.description: A short description of the enterprise.

slug.description: The slug url identifier for the enterprise.

team.title: Team
team.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

nullable-team-simple.title: Team Simple
nullable-team-simple.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories

privacy.description: The level of privacy this team should have

notification_setting.description: The notification setting the team has set

ldap_dn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) that team maps to within LDAP environment

moved-column-in-project-issue-event.title: Moved Column in Project Issue Event
moved-column-in-project-issue-event.description: Moved Column in Project Issue Event

converted-note-to-issue-issue-event.title: Converted Note to Issue Issue Event
converted-note-to-issue-issue-event.description: Converted Note to Issue Issue Event

integration.title: GitHub app
integration.description: GitHub apps are a new way to extend GitHub. They can be installed directly on organizations and user accounts and granted access to specific repositories. They come with granular permissions and built-in webhooks. GitHub apps are first class actors within GitHub.

id.description: Unique identifier of the GitHub app

slug.description: The slug name of the GitHub app

name.description: The name of the GitHub app

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the GitHub app

events.description: The list of events for the GitHub app

installations_count.description: The number of installations associated with the GitHub app

id.description: Unique identifier of the issue comment

body.example: What version of Safari were you using when you observed this bug?

author-association.title: author_association
author-association.description: How the author is associated with the repository.

issue.title: Issue
issue.description: Issues are a great way to keep track of tasks, enhancements, and bugs for your projects.

number.description: Number uniquely identifying the issue within its repository

state.description: State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'

state_reason.description: The reason for the current state

title.example: Widget creation fails in Safari on OS X 10.8

body.example: It looks like the new widget form is broken on Safari. When I try and create the widget, Safari crashes. This is reproducible on 10.8, but not 10.9. Maybe a browser bug?

labels.description: Labels to associate with this issue; pass one or more label names to replace the set of labels on this issue; send an empty array to clear all labels from the issue; note that the labels are silently dropped for users without push access to the repository

nullable-milestone.title: Milestone
nullable-milestone.description: A collection of related issues and pull requests.

id.description: The unique identifier of the issue type.

node_id.description: The node identifier of the issue type.

name.description: The name of the issue type.

description.description: The description of the issue type.

color.description: The color of the issue type.

created_at.description: The time the issue type created.

updated_at.description: The time the issue type last updated.

is_enabled.description: The enabled state of the issue type.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.

size.description: The size of the repository, in kilobytes. Size is calculated hourly. When a repository is initially created, the size is 0.

default_branch.description: The default branch of the repository.

is_template.description: Whether this repository acts as a template that can be used to generate new repositories.

disabled.description: Returns whether or not this repository disabled.

visibility.description: The repository visibility: public, private, or internal.

allow_rebase_merge.description: Whether to allow rebase merges for pull requests.

allow_squash_merge.description: Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.

allow_auto_merge.description: Whether to allow Auto-merge to be used on pull requests.

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Whether to delete head branches when pull requests are merged

allow_update_branch.description: Whether or not a pull request head branch that is behind its base branch can always be updated even if it is not required to be up to date before merging.

use_squash_pr_title_as_default.description: Whether a squash merge commit can use the pull request title as default. **This property is closing down. Please use `squash_merge_commit_title` instead.

squash_merge_commit_title.description:
The default value for a squash merge commit title:

- `PR_TITLE` - default to the pull request's title.
- `COMMIT_OR_PR_TITLE` - default to the commit's title (if only one commit) or the pull request's title (when more than one commit).

squash_merge_commit_message.description:
The default value for a squash merge commit message:

- `PR_BODY` - default to the pull request's body.
- `COMMIT_MESSAGES` - default to the branch's commit messages.
- `BLANK` - default to a blank commit message.

merge_commit_title.description:
The default value for a merge commit title.

- `PR_TITLE` - default to the pull request's title.
- `MERGE_MESSAGE` - default to the classic title for a merge message (e.g., Merge pull request #123 from branch-name).

merge_commit_message.description:
The default value for a merge commit message.

- `PR_TITLE` - default to the pull request's title.
- `PR_BODY` - default to the pull request's body.
- `BLANK` - default to a blank commit message.

allow_merge_commit.description: Whether to allow merge commits for pull requests.

allow_forking.description: Whether to allow forking this repo

web_commit_signoff_required.description: Whether to require contributors to sign off on web-based commits

anonymous_access_enabled.description: Whether anonymous git access is enabled for this repository

email.description: Git email address of the user
Git email address of the user

message.description: Message describing the purpose of the commit

commit_id.description: A commit SHA for the review.

pull-request-review-comment.title: Pull Request Review Comment
pull-request-review-comment.description: Pull Request Review Comments are comments on a portion of the Pull Request's diff.

url.description: URL for the pull request review comment

pull_request_review_id.description: The ID of the pull request review to which the comment belongs.

id.description: The ID of the pull request review comment.

node_id.description: The node ID of the pull request review comment.

diff_hunk.description: The diff of the line that the comment refers to.

path.description: The relative path of the file to which the comment applies.

position.description: The line index in the diff to which the comment applies. This field is closing down; use `line` instead.

original_position.description: The index of the original line in the diff to which the comment applies. This field is closing down; use `original_line` instead.

commit_id.description: The SHA of the commit to which the comment applies.

original_commit_id.description: The SHA of the original commit to which the comment applies.

in_reply_to_id.description: The comment ID to reply to.

body.example: We should probably include a check for null values here.

html_url.description: HTML URL for the pull request review comment.

pull_request_url.description: URL for the pull request that the review comment belongs to.

start_line.description: The first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

original_start_line.description: The first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

start_side.description: The side of the first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

original_line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

side.description: The side of the diff to which the comment applies. The side of the last line of the range for a multi-line comment

subject_type.description: The level at which the comment is targeted, can be a diff line or a file.
